Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn & others, I am just 42 and have breast cancer for the 2nd time- I have exactly the same situation as you Carolyn as this time it has spread to my lymphnodes in my abdomen & had kidney issues & had 2 stents put in. I was given 3 sessions of Taxitere, had a scan last week & it's not working. My onc has switched me to Taxol & Gemzar, started that last Friday-had a very rough week last week after all this news. I had cancer 3 years ago & thought I was doing great. My husband left 2 years ago cuz he couldn't handle it & sometimes I feel very alone although I have great friends & family. I stumbled upon this site & hope it will help with suggestions & coping. I can't take any hormones, as I am er-hr-. I am going to try some alternative medicines & am radically trying to change my diet-NO SUGAR! anyway-love to hear from anyone who can perk me up! Thanks Linda
Posts.Title: stg 4/reaccurance b.c. in abdomen now

Posts.Content: Carolyn, Actually, I have had no side effects to speak of! It's a little strange, I'm wondering if it's working... My doc has given me 100% of the taxol, and 80% of the gemzar- next week I'll get 90%. Overall, hasn't been bad, just tired & no stamina, which is to be expected. Tell me how your scans went- I have prayed that they good results. This week I am going to explore a healing touch practioner & also some guided imagery class. Can't hurt right? Linda
Posts.Title: stg 4/reaccurance b.c. in abdomen now

Posts.Content: On 8/7/2009 thimbles26 wrote: Wondering if any of you have had my experience of being on 9 treatments in 3.5 years with more progression after trying each one. ER positive but even the anti-hormonals didn't do a thing. Joanne I was diagnosed in Dec 08 that my bc had meta to my lymphnodes in my abdomen after 3.5 years of remission. I have been on 5 diff chemos since Jan & the tumors have still been growing. I am now on taxol & avastin which is a prohibitor to starve the cancer cells. I think it's working, but I've been dissappointed so many times, I can't get my hopes up. I am triple neg so can't do any hormone therapies. I am 42 & very scared that this has come back & had alot more complications & trauma since the first bout in 04. I guess all we can do is keep trying & hope something will work-I know you're supposed to stay positive & I try, but when its setback after setback, it's tough! So stay as positive as you can and surround yourself with positive people.
Posts.Title: Met. Breast Cancer unresponsive to many chemos!

Posts.Content: I think that is what "encapsulated" means- I believe that's a really good thing! as far as news goes. I had 16 nodes taken out & 13 were positive- I think you're doing great! Linda
Posts.Title: lymph nodes

Posts.Content: On 3/3/2009 paddy 01 wrote:   On 3/3/2009 survivorchic wrote: I was misdiagnosed at age 37. I had to push & push to get a baseline mamo at 32 because my mother had breast cancer. They finally gave me one at 32. At 37 they told me the lump on the mamo was just a cyst, to lay off the cafeine & come back in 6 months. I did what the radiologist said & 8 months later I was told I had cancer, that it had spread to my lymphnodes & had to have a mastectomy! Do not wait, trust yourself & your body, we know it best! I now have reaccuring b.cancer & perphaps if all this had been caught earlier, I wouldn't be in this situation now! You have to be strong, tough and not take no for an answer. Cancer doesn't seem to care about age, so don't let these docs push you off because of that. I would get a biopsy right away & see what you're really dealing with. These people are not God & should never be cocky enough to think they know all the answers. Make that appt today & you can have some peace in your mind. Let us know how you make out-lot's of support here just ask Linda Linda, may we ask how old you are? Also, how are you doing?  your reaccurances, are they in check now or are you still fighting the beast?stage?I am now 42 & unfortunately in Dec found out it's back-I was in remission for 3 years. I am on chemo, 2nd batch of drugs because the first drug didn't shrink the tumors which are now in my abdomen. Considered stage 4 since metastatic. I'm praying these drugs will work- had 1 cycle so far. No side effects which is weird, but great!
Posts.Title: misdiagnosis?!?!?!

Posts.Content: I was misdiagnosed at age 37. I had to push & push to get a baseline mamo at 32 because my mother had breast cancer. They finally gave me one at 32. At 37 they told me the lump on the mamo was just a cyst, to lay off the cafeine & come back in 6 months. I did what the radiologist said & 8 months later I was told I had cancer, that it had spread to my lymphnodes & had to have a mastectomy! Do not wait, trust yourself & your body, we know it best! I now have reaccuring b.cancer & perphaps if all this had been caught earlier, I wouldn't be in this situation now! You have to be strong, tough and not take no for an answer. Cancer doesn't seem to care about age, so don't let these docs push you off because of that. I would get a biopsy right away & see what you're really dealing with. These people are not God & should never be cocky enough to think they know all the answers. Make that appt today & you can have some peace in your mind. Let us know how you make out-lot's of support here just ask Linda
Posts.Title: misdiagnosis?!?!?!

Posts.Content: On 2/4/2009 Scrunch wrote:   On 2/3/2009 rose1325 wrote: I need to select a treat ment for breast cancer stage 4 that spread to the omentum of the peritoneal lining.  My liver and other organs are all right but there is fluid in the abdomen and pelvis.  My doctor stopped arimidex and wants to put me on tamoxafin.  I wondered if there are any other options.   Tahnk you Hello Rose, I had breast cancer in 2001 and last July was diagnosed with Stage IV Peritoneal Carcinomatosis, which was traced to the breast cancer.  So far, it hasn't penetrated any internal organs, but it did crowd many of them.  My kidneys were swollen and the ureters were crimped, so they put stents in both ureters.  But to get to the point, I was first put on Arimidex, which didn't work.  Now they have me on Taxol infusions, which are working.  My tumor markers (last time they checked) have come down to 39, which is nearly normal.  I have 3 more infusions, and then they are going to do scans to see what is going on.  I so seldom hear about anybody else who has this that I had to contact you and commiserate about the situation.  I keep worrying about when it might penetrate any of the internal organs, especially the colon, because I don't want peritonitis.  Feel free to contact me any time to discuss our common condition.  Best wishes, Carolyn             Hi Carolyn & others, I am just 42 and have breast cancer for the 2nd time- I have exactly the same situation as you Carolyn as this time it has spread to my lymphnodes in my abdomen & had kidney issues & had 2 stents put in. I was given 3 sessions of Taxitere, had a scan last week & it's not working. My onc has switched me to Taxol & Gemzar, started that last Friday-had a very rough week last week after all this news. I had cancer 3 years ago & thought I was doing great. My husband left 2 years ago cuz he couldn't handle it & sometimes I feel very alone although I have great friends & family. I stumbled upon this site & hope it will help with suggestions & coping. I can't take any hormones, as I am er-hr-. I am going to try some alternative medicines & am radically trying to change my diet-NO SUGAR! anyway-love to hear from anyone who can perk me up! Thanks Linda
Posts.Title: Any information on peritoneal breast cancer spread?
